Dear Domonique Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Linda Tansil, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Staff person 1 pulled Youth A's arms, pushed him against the wall,
restrained him on the ground and then in a seated restraint
position.
Investigation Complainant
I interviewed Complainant on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine Center.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A
I attempted to interview Youth A on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine
Center with another Department of Health and Human Service
worker. Youth A refused the interview and stormed out of the
cafeteria after I introduced myself.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker. Youth
B stated he did not hear what was said but heard Youth A yelling
and screaming at Staff person 1. Youth B stated Youth A swung
and tried to hit Staff person 1. Youth B stated Staff person 1
stretched his arm out towards Youth A’s chest and then pinned
Youth A against the door with his hands. Youth B stated Youth A
said, “Let me go” and Staff person 1 released Youth A. Youth B
stated Youth A ran down the hallway and he did not see anything
further because he directed to move out of the hallway.
Youth C
I attempted to interview Youth C on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine
Center with another Department of Health and Human Service
worker because he was a witness to the incident based on the
video footage. Youth C was unable to provide any information.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine Center
with another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Staff person 1 stated redirected Youth A when he tried to enter the
kitchen to get food. Staff person 1 stated he told Youth A that he
would get him something to eat after he was done dividing the
groups. Staff person 1 stated Youth A became upset and angry
and Staff person 1 redirected Youth A to step into the hallway.
Staff person 1 stated Youth A “nudged” him in the doorway when
Youth A tried to go back to the kitchen again. Staff person 1 stated
Youth A walked towards him saying Staff person 1 did not care
that he was hungry. Staff person 1 stated he took Youth A’s
forearm when Youth A acted like he was going to attack him and
tried to secure Youth A against the wall. Staff person 1 stated
2

Youth A struggled, and he secured Youth A against the door for 5
to 10 seconds. Staff person 1 stated Supervisor 1 came and
redirected Youth A. Staff person 1 stated he walked Youth A down
the hallway with his arms wrapped around Youth A, but Youth A
slid to the ground on his side and then on to his chest and side.
Staff person 1 stated he then secured Youth A into a seated hold
position and released Youth A when he calmed down.
Supervisor 1
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Supervisor 1 stated she was in the main office when she heard a
noise and headed to the hallway. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A
yelled that Staff person 1 slammed him against the wall and staff
did not care. Supervisor 1 stated she redirected Youth A to settle
down while Staff person 1 stood behind Youth A and secured
Youth A’s arms to the side. Supervisor 1 stated Staff person 1 and
Youth A walked down the hall and then saw Youth A on his side
on the ground with Staff person 1 on the ground behind Youth A.
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A yelled for Staff person 1 to let him go
and threatened to hit Staff person 1. Supervisor 1 stated Staff
person 1 did not respond, but transitioned Youth A into a seated
hold. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was released once he calmed
down and he went back towards Staff person 1. Supervisor 1
stated she redirected Youth A away from Staff person 1 and
stayed with Youth A until the end of her shift. Supervisor 1 stated
she did not see any marks on Youth A, but Youth A refused over
the counter medication and medical evaluation for lower back
pain.
Video
I reviewed the 06/11/2023 video tape at 9:28 pm with another
Department of Health and Human Service worker. Video tape
shows Staff person 1 pushed Youth A’s backside against the
hallway wall. Staff person 1 walked behind Youth A with Youth A’s
arms secured to the side down the hallway until Youth A went to
the floor on his right side and then half prone (chest to the ground
with the right side of his right leg on the ground) with Staff person
1 over Youth A. Staff person 1 repositioned Youth A into a seated
hold position. Supervisor 1 was present when Youth A transitioned
from the ground to a seated hold position. The video tape shows
an open door that blocks the view of what happens after Youth A
is against the hallway wall and walked down the hallway.
3

Incident report
Reviewed Staff person 1 and Supervisor 1’s 06/11/2023 incident
reports. Their incident reports parallel their interviews.
Personnel file
Staff person 1 was hired on 06/28/2022. Staff person 1 completed
Nonviolent Crisis Prevention Intervention training on 02/19/2023.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency
completed an investigation without findings.
Analysis Staff person 1 stated he tried to secure Youth A against the wall
and managed to secure Youth A against a door. Youth B stated
he saw Staff person 1 secure Youth A against a door. Youth A
refused an interview. Video footage shows Staff Person 1 pushed
Youth A against a wall on his backside. It does not capture Staff
person 1 securing Youth A against the door because the door is
open and blocking the camera view. Pushing a youth against a
wall is not permitted.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Staff are to release a youth when a youth is in a partial
prone position.
• Seated hold is used for a small child. Youth A is 13 years
old with a stocky build. Please verify with a certified
Nonviolent Crisis Prevention Intervention trainer the height
and weight parameters for a seated hold.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
